chapter.title: Eclipse Designer
chapter.para: Activiti comes with an Eclipse plugin that can be used to graphically model BPMN 2.0 processes Eclipse. This initiative is started and currently maintained by Tijs Rademakers, Tiese Barrell, Ron van Liempd and Yvo Swillens.

section.title: Installation
section.para: The following installation instructions are verified on a classic Eclipse Helios environment.

Go to Help -> Install New Software. In the following panel, click on Add button and fill in the following fields:
Name: Activiti BPMN 2.0 designer
Location: http://activiti.org/designer/update/

listitem.para: Support for start event, end event, sequence flow, parallel gateway, exclusive gateway, embedded subprocess, script task, user task and service task.
Export the graphical model to BPMN 2.0 XML
Support for the activiti extensions: Java class configuration, assignee and candidate user/group.
Generate a unit test (right click on an XML file in the package explorer and select generate test handler) and run it on an embedded h2 database.
